content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="f of x, equals, b times x squared, plus 3 b x, plus b squared, plus, the fraction 1 over x squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>b</mi><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>b</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>, where <math alttext="b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is a nonzero constant. Which of the following is an expression for <math alttext="f prime of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, the derivative of <math alttext="f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="2 b x, plus 3 b, minus the fraction 2 over x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>b</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>b</mi><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 b x, plus 3 b, minus the fraction 2 over x cubed, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>b</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>b</mi><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 b x, plus 3 b, plus b squared, minus the fraction 2 over x cubed, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>b</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>b</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="x squared, plus 3 x, plus 2 b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>b</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2 b x, plus 3 b, minus the fraction 2 over x cubed, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>b</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>b</mi><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 2.6: Derivative Rules - Constant, Sum, Difference, and Constant Multiple

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
